185949648.review: Finally finished this miserysimulator after forcing myself to play it. Most choices dont seem to matter and just leads to the characters getting punished, humiliated or killed. The creators clearly thought that what makes Game of thrones is just alot of misery and carnage and little else. I'm glad this is over so I can uninstall and try to forget.

185572841.review:
Ayant fait ce jeu avant d'avoir vu le moindre épisode de Game of Thrones, je peux dire qu'une connaissance de la série ou des livres n'est pas requise.
On reste ici dans la lignée des jeux Telltale Games de cette époque.
Les différents épisodes sont assez plaisants. Les personnages sont nombreux et je pense que l'ADN de l'œuvre originale est plutôt adapté à ce style de jeu à choix, même si, comme d'habitude, les choix n'ont au final que peu d'impact. Cela fonctionne tout de même au niveau de l'immersion.
Je mettrais ce Game of Thrones plutôt dans le panier haut des productions du studio dans le genre du récit interactif (que je distingue des point & click comme Sam & Max de leur première période).

184761617.review: Poznajemy konflikt znany z książek i gier ale z perspektywy pomniejszego rodu. Niestety fabuła jakby niedokończona, jednocześnie jako gracz czuję że moje decyzje nie mają ostatecznie znaczenia,

184695023.review:
If you know TellTale games then you know what you are up to.
The Story this one covers is set in the Game Of Thrones universe and is very well written.
It is a lot of fun and very exciting to follow the characters of House Forrester in their challanging times during the war. You have to make tough decisions and try to maintain a posible future for the House.
The actual gameplay is again more minimalistic. It is about he discussions with other characters, the responses you give and the choices you make. While the 6 Episodes last you will meet a lot of characters from the big tv series with their original voices. The add a lot of atmosphere and make for a lot of exciting moments.

If you are a fan of the brand of Game Of Thrones then this one is a no brainer for you.

Unfortunately it is very difficult to get this game nowadays.
I guess there are sources out there....

Sincerely Yours
StoryOfTheGame

183981765.review:
[b] Welcome to Westeros, Where Everyone's Gonna Die Anyway [/b]

Telltale Games brings the world of Westeros to life with Game of Thrones: A Telltale Games Series, a narrative-driven adventure that captures the political intrigue, brutality, and despair fans of the show and books have come to expect. It’s a six-episode rollercoaster that plunges you deep into the chaos of the Seven Kingdoms, where your decisions will haunt you and your favorite characters are never truly safe.

You play as various members of House Forrester, a noble family loyal to the Starks. The Forresters are embroiled in the War of the Five Kings, juggling rivalries, betrayal, and survival as their house teeters on the brink of ruin. The narrative is gripping, weaving original characters with familiar faces like Tyrion Lannister, Jon Snow, and Daenerys Targaryen. Each choice you make feels weighty, but in true Game of Thrones fashion, the consequences are often cruel and unavoidable. Whether negotiating in King’s Landing, commanding soldiers in battle, or managing alliances, the story delivers high-stakes drama at every turn.

As with other Telltale games, the focus is on narrative choices and dialogue. Quick-time events (QTEs) keep the action engaging during battles, while decision-making drives the plot forward. Every choice carries the illusion of importance, though the overarching story remains largely fixed. For fans of immersive storytelling, this formula works well. For players looking for more control or varied gameplay mechanics, it might feel limiting.

The art style emulates a painted aesthetic, giving the game a unique look. While the visuals can feel dated or inconsistent at times, the environments effectively capture the grim beauty of Westeros.

If you love Game of Thrones for its grim storytelling and enjoy Telltale’s brand of “your choices matter (but not really),” then this is the game for you. Just don’t get attached to anyone. Seriously.
